Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Longipin (natural AMPs; arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1a; BBBh2o)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 40.9% similarity toLividin 8 HLmb.Activity: Active against S. aureus ATCC29213M (MIC>120 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC12228 (MIC>120 uM), M.luteus BR2 (MIC >120 uM), M. luteus A270 (MIC 60-120 uM), Gram- P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 60-120 uM), E.coli D31 or SBS363 (MIC > 120 uM), S. marcescens ATCC4112 (MIC 60-120 uM), E.cloacae beta12 (MIC > 120 uM), fungi C. albicans MDM8 or IOC4558 (MIC 7.5-30 uM), C. guilliermondii (MIC 3.8-7.5 uM) and C. tropicalis (MIC 3.8-7.5 uM), filamentous fungi A.niger (MIC> 120 uM), C.herbarum ATCC26362 (MIC> 120 uM), and P.farinosus IBCB251 (MIC> 120 uM).  Also, longipin can form amyloid-like structure (Amyloid AMPs).Updated 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Sayegh RS, Batista IF, Melo RL, Riske KA, Daffre S, Montich G, da Silva Junior PI.2016
Literature Information.Title: Longipin: An Amyloid Antimicrobial Peptide from the Harvestman Acutisoma longipes (Arachnida: Opiliones) with Preferential Affinity for Anionic Vesicles
